Gathering detailed requirements from stakeholders to understand project objectives and needs
Creating clear, concise, and comprehensive requirement documents for the development team
Ensuring that the documented requirements match the actual needs of the stakeholders
Tracking requirements throughout the project lifecycle to ensure they are met in the final product
Determining the order in which requirements should be addressed based on importance and dependencies
Recognizing all parties affected by the project and their interests
Keeping stakeholders informed about project progress, changes, and other relevant information
Establishing and maintaining positive relationships with stakeholders to ensure smooth project execution
Evaluating the practicality of proposed solutions in terms of technical, financial, and operational aspects
Ensuring that the developed solution meets the requirements and solves the business problem
Identifying differences between the current state and the desired state of a system or process
Creating visual representations of business processes to understand and analyze their flow
Identifying inefficiencies in processes and proposing enhancements
Describing interactions between users and systems to achieve specific goals
Creating representations of data structures and relationships
Ensuring that data is accurate, consistent, and usable
Mastery of tools like JIRA, Confluence, MS Visio, etc., used in business analysis tasks
Bridging the gap between non-technical stakeholders and the technical team
Recognizing potential threats to the project's success
Evaluating the potential impact and likelihood of identified risks
Proposing strategies to reduce or eliminate risks
Handling requests for changes in the project after the initial requirements have been set
Assessing the potential effects of proposed changes on the project
